typeSystemDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.typesystems.NeuralTypeSystem
typeSystemDescription.description: This type system contains types for neural networks.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.Wordpiece
typeDescription.description: A tokenized part of a word.

featureDescription.name: normalized
featureDescription.description: Normalized (and lowercased) version of the wordpiece without accents.

featureDescription.name: embedding
featureDescription.description: Optional embedding of this wordpiece.

featureDescription.name: tokenStart
featureDescription.description: Flag indicating that the word piece is located at the beginning of a token.

featureDescription.name: tokenStartWordpiece
featureDescription.description: Optional reference to additional wordpiece representing the start of a token.

featureDescription.name: vocabularyIndex
featureDescription.description: Index of wordpiece in the vocabulary.

featureDescription.name: group
featureDescription.description: Optional group identifier for distinguishing different layers of wordpieces.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.Embedding
typeDescription.description: Represents an embedding for a given target annotation.

featureDescription.name: vector
featureDescription.description: The actual dense embedding vector.

featureDescription.name: dimension
featureDescription.description: The dimension of the embedding.

featureDescription.name: kind
featureDescription.description: The kind of the embedding.

featureDescription.name: id
featureDescription.description: Identifier representing the embedding model.

featureDescription.name: reference
featureDescription.description: The original annotation represented by the embedding.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.WordEmbedding
typeDescription.description: Represents a word embedding for a given target annotation.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.WordpieceEmbedding
typeDescription.description: Represents a wordpiece embedding for a given target annotation.

featureDescription.name: tokenStartEmbedding
featureDescription.description: Optional embedding of an additional token start wordpiece.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.SentenceEmbedding
typeDescription.description: Represents a sentence embedding for a given target annotation.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.ConceptEmbedding
typeDescription.description: Represents a concept embedding for a given target annotation.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.ParagraphEmbedding
typeDescription.description: Represents a paragraph embedding for a given target annotation.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.DocumentEmbedding
typeDescription.description: Represents a document embedding for a given target annotation.

featureDescription.name: group
featureDescription.description: The group to which the statement belongs. A particular annotator typically process all statements belonging to a certain group. The group is typically a parameter to the annotator.

featureDescription.name: result
featureDescription.description: The entailment result. Typically "true" or "false", depending on whether the statement follows from the context or not.

featureDescription.name: context
featureDescription.description: The context that should be used to interpret the statement. Typically, the annotator will use the covered text of these annotations and provide them to an LLM to check if the statement appears to follow from the given context information. If this feature is not set or empty, the entire document will typically be used as the context.

featureDescription.name: justification
featureDescription.description: The annotator can provide a justification for its decision here. Typically, the LLM would be asked to provide this justification. This can be helpful for debugging or optimization purposes, e.g. to enhance the task description to better explain how decisions should be made.

featureDescription.name: statement
featureDescription.description: The statement that should be checked. This is typically generated by a Ruta script or other annotator from based on existing annotations. For example to check if a flu diagnosis annotation is correct in its context, the statement could be generated as "The patient suffers from flu." The annotator would then provide the statement and the context to an LLM to check if the statement follows from the context.

featureDescription.name: target
featureDescription.description: The annotation from which the statement was derived. This is typically the annotation that needs to be removed or fixed if the entailment result is negative.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.LLMContextMessages
typeDescription.description: Additional information providing contextual messages for a specific LLM annotator, e.g., in-context learning examples.

featureDescription.name: messagesJson
featureDescription.description: The actual message for a specific annotation in its Json format.

featureDescription.name: group
featureDescription.description: The group to which the message belongs. A particular annotator typically process all statements belonging to a certain group. The group is typically a parameter to the annotator.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.DocumentChunk
typeDescription.description: An annotation representing a chunk of a document and linkage to a corresponding embedding.

featureDescription.name: embedding
featureDescription.description: The vector representing the chunk.

featureDescription.name: prefix
featureDescription.description: Optional additional text that is prefixed before the text is embedded.

featureDescription.name: ignoreCoveredText
featureDescription.description: Optional to ignore the covered text of this annoation and to use only the prefix.

featureDescription.name: group
featureDescription.description: The group to which the DocumentChunk belongs. A particular annotator typically process all chunks belonging to a certain group. The group is typically a parameter to the annotator.

featureDescription.name: reference
featureDescription.description: Optional reference to a source annotation if available on which this annotation is based.
